BrightBlade:

: BrightBlade growls as she sees Chordate run into the room, not failing to 
notice that Perndabot had spied him as well.
She swears as the Maximal puts on the sprinklers, snapping her head towards 
Perndabot and seeing his outline. But thank the pit that she wasn�t able to 
be detected.
BrightBlade looked back towards Chordate and began to walk towards him, her 
steps silent as she approached the Maximal.
She gave the Alliance bot a signal with her hand not to shoot, taking a 
small contained from her leg compartment.
It was the same device that had taken out rex, only she was going to get it 
directly to this Maximal so that it wouldn�t affect Perndabot�she needed him 
still.
With a growl she pulled the pin on the gas bomb and threw it right between 
Chordates� legs. A clear gas hissing up into the air around the Maximal.
If all worked well it would make him go into stasis lock, fast and silent.
BrightBlade looked towards the Alliance bot, taking another piece of 
equipment out of her leg.
The reflecting device that shielded her so well, but just another one.
She tossed to him.:

� On the cloaking device, quickly.�

: BrightBlade then looked towards Chordate again.:

� We have much to do��



Rage:

: She watched through the shield of leavs ahead of her, her prey in her 
sight.
her longer front limbs supporting her great weight as she stalked through 
the forest growth, relying on surprise.
Rages bulk couldn't easily be hidden, thus, she was forced to stalk the best 
she could and then just strike.
Her prey, a forest buck.
But there was the close smell of metal that clouded her senses sometimes 
now, the scent familiar but her mind still dwelling on her prey.
Suddenly, the male deers head snapped up, looking around a bit to locate a 
distant sound it had heard.
Rages muscles bunched under her great bulk for a body as she saw it raise 
its head, her mind knowing that her meal could bolt any moment.
And just as suddenly as the deer had looked up, it raised it's tail in 
warning and bounded off into the forest shadows.
Rage snarled and raised to her muscled hind legs, the trees and bushes 
giving way as she gave chase to her prey.
The buck fled in panic but the great monsters hunger was to strong this 
time, and in the end she would be triumphant.

The buck burst from the cover of the forest, not knowing that it had entered 
into the clearing where the Alliance base stood, it's panic blinding it.
But then it slowed, it's sides heaving and trying to take in enough breath 
to fuel it's quickly beating heart.
Now in the center of the clearing, there was nothing which followed.
The buck looked around, only seeing the line of trees and the large metal 
thing a bit off to the left.
The deer relaxed and began to move off towards the other side of the forest, 
it's senses still open and aware of everything around it.
But even that didn't save it.

A pair of huge jaws burst from the forest and into the clearing, easily 
clearing the space between her and the buck in two strides.
The buck didn't even have enough time to take another breath before massive 
jaws closed around it's middle, snapping down and splitting the animal in 
half with a sprey of warm blood and meat.

Rage lifted her head from what was left of the buck, her jaws dripping with 
the warm blood of her kill.
This was turning out to be a good day for her.
She looked over and saw what she had been smelling while stalking this deer, 
a large ship but one that she had never seen before.
But then she looked down at the gutted buck and roared before digging her 
jaws into the meat, taring off chunks of flesh.
Though, a animal this side would be nothing more then a snack.:
